messages.body:
Received: from 
 (SOGEQUIP/Firstnet, Benin) 
Mon, 27 Jun 2005


Dearest: Friend,

My Name is Mr.JONES MAGORO a credit officer with the one of the leading (Finance Trust House) here in Cotonou Republic Du Benin. In my department i discovered an abandoned funds (USD 12 M) in an account that belongs to one of our foreign customer (MR. ANDREAS SCHRANNER from Munich, Germany) who died along with his entire family in July 2000 in a plane crash.


http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/europe/859479.stm

Since i got information about his death, I have been expecting his next of kin to come over and claim his money because we cannot release it unless some body applies for it as next of kin or relation to the deceased as indicated in our banking guidlings and laws but unfortunately we learnt that all his supposed next of kin or relation died alongside with him at the plane crash leaving nobody behind for the claim. It is therefore upon this discovery that I now decided to make this business proposal to you and release the money to you as the next of kin or relation to the deceased for safety and subsequent disbursement since nobody is coming for it and we don't want this money to go into the bank treasury as unclaimed bill.

The banking law and guidline here stipulates that if such money remained unclaimed after Six years, the money will be transfered into the bank treasury as unclaimed fund. The request of foreigner as next of kin in this business is occassioned by the fact that the customer was a foreigner and an Indigenecannot stand as next of kin to a foreigner.

Your percentage will be declare to you as soon as you indicate your interest.I will visit your country for disbursement according to the percentage indicated

MR.JONES MAGORO
HEAD OF CREDIT/COOPERATE ACCOUNT 
DEPARTMENT ECOBANK COTONOU BENIN REPUBLIC.
TELEPHONE:00229-981193
E-mail:j_magoro76@yahoo.ca

My Dear Friend,


Thanks for your mail just received,as regards to you mail I assured you that all the process will be parfected legally, 

Listen carefully if your really want to enter into this deal with me, I want you to adhere to my instruction for us to achieve this our great goal. my good friend I believe this is a great opportunity for us and I will do everything possible to grab this opportunity,please I want you to give me all the necessary assistance needed to get this fund transfer to your Bank account, 

Now you need to send some requirement which we can use to process the payment as the Beneficiary/next of kin to our late client, as soon as I receive the requirement my lawyer Barrister Jean Sako will proceed to high court of justice to sworn an Affidavit of claim and obtain the Certificate of Authenticity in your behalf as the next of kin to our late client MR.ANDREAS SCHRANNER as soon as my lawyer obtain those documents from high court of justice, he will forward them to the foreign remittance department for verification and immediate processing of the fund transfer, 


Meanwhile here is the requirement which youn need to send to me immediately

1)Your full name and address.

2)Your direct telephone and fax numbers for easy communication,

3)Your age and occupation,

Note that you need to send this requirement to me immediately to avoid any further delay in this transaction. I want this money to enter your account before mid next week.

After receiving the requirement I will send to you a FORM which stand as DEMAND LETTER OF CLAIM, you will fill it and send to the foreign remittance department of this Bank to make our claim more authentic.
Please you should keep this transction very confidential so that we can work everything out in discreed and private manner
For your intrest to assist me actualize this dream I will give you 35% of the money,

As soon as the fund enter into your account I and my lawyer will
come over to your Country to meet you and collect my own share of the money.
Once again thanks for your co-operation and understanding. 

I look forward to hear from you soon.

Thanks and God bless

JONES MAGORO

Magoro Jones, 


This sounds like a good deal. I did tell my brother Tommy about this opportunity, I hope that won't be a problem. He's a real good guy, a little "quick on the trigger" sometimes, but he's been taking some classes in anger management, so he'll be all right. 


My name: Raymond Anzio Gunn 


Phone number: 2024355031 (no FAX number, sorry) 


My age: 54 Tommy is 52. We operate our own little business, "The Gunn Shop", which is a small-arms retailer and appliance-repair shop. We live in Gatling, Wyoming. 


Is this sufficient for your needs at this time? 


Raymond Gunn

Sorry about the mix-up.

messages.body:
There was a glitch in the scanner's e-mail application. With a little extra work, I am able to send it in PDF form. 


I appreciate you sending the form as it arrived to you, now I see what went wrong with sending the application. No wonder you thought it looks "childish" and like "rubbish" (although I admit that when I first read those reactions, I was highly insulted at your attitudes, and nearly told you both to forget about the whole thing!) 


You must be aware that I did not do this on purpose! It was an accident, a small problem with the scanner-device. I would not presume to toy with you in this matter, nor would I try to promote hard feelings. 


I apologize for the delay. 


Ray Gunn
messages.raw:

I apologize for the delay.

Ray Gunn

Dear Martins Dossou, 


We will get the money transferred by Western Union tomorrow morning, before we open our store for business. If we are a few minutes late, our assistant, a fine young fellow (whom we trust, and has been with us for almost 5 years) named Buck Schott, will open the doors. 


We will send it in the name of your secretary, ROSELIN GLOKPON (what kind of name is that? I never heard of such a strange-sounding name. Is it a native name to Cotonou?)

Thanks, Ray Gunn

messages.body:
Dear Jones Magoro, 


It is not necessary to send mail twice. Just hit the "Send" ONCE!!!! 


I know you must be in a very great hurry to secure this money, as you apparently did not read over your mail to correct any mistakes. This shows a great lack of respect for the person you are addressing, that you will send out sloppy and foolish-looking mail.

It also makes me think that you are not a well-educated man, the kind of person that has no business in a position of importance. Is this the case? Are you in such a blundering big hurry, or are you naturally sloppy, or do you just not care about the recipient of your correspondence? 


Ray Gunn

Martins Dossou, 


I sent Tommy with the money to Western Union yesterday, and I haven't heard from him since he left our shop at 4:30! 


I have notified the local sheriff to round up a posse to search for him, I gave Sheriff O'Nottingham a list all the people he knows, and the pubs he frequents, but Sheriff couldn't round him up. 


I am getting worried, I hope he wasn't waylaid by thugs. He had the money in large bills, and I sure hope he didn't go waving all that cash around! 


Ray Gunn

messages.body:
Jones Magoro, 


I am appalled at this mail of yours, and your uncaring attitude! I guess I shouldn't be too surprised, a man who drinks on the job the way you do, is bound to have a total disregard for anybody else's worries. Even your co-worker Dossou is keeping you under surveillance, so that your employers will know when you are drunk, and then you will be out of a job! 


You say you doubt my story? Well, good for you, mister--you and I are finished! I prefer to work with Dossou anyway, At least he is a sober man, and he seems to respect me and my concern for my brother Tommy. 


For your information, we did find Tommy. Just as I suspected, he visited a local bar "for a cold one", and started waving around all that cash, and when he went to get into his car, he was grabbed by a couple of guys, beaten, and robbed. He is lying in the hospital now with bruises all over, and a broken nose. It's a wonder they didn't kill him--people have been murdered for less money than he had on him. 


I hope you're happy, you didn't believe me when I said Tommy disappeared, and now look at what happened! 


Ray Gunn

messages.body:
Dear Martins Dossou, 


Thank you for your letter of concern for my brother Tommy. I have spent every minute I could, by his side in the hospital. He has lapsed into a deep coma, and the doctors fear the worst. It seems that those thugs who attacked Tommy kicked him repeatedly in the head, and he suffered several other serious injuries.

At first they weren't noticeable, as the bruises were under his hair, but the extent of this damage became obvious when they examined him thoroughly.

I heard from Jones Magoro yesterday, and he wrote such insulting things about my brother! I am appalled that he would be so unkind and unsympathetic to somebody who has suffered such a trauma! I will not write to him again, I am firmly convinced that Magoro is the worst kind of a drunkard, who cares nothing for anyone else, only himself. You should have him fired IMMEDIATELY! 


I do not know when I will be able to write again.

Ray Gunn

messages.body:
Jones Magoro:

I can't tell you how surprised I was to see mail from you this morning!

When I didn't hear from you again, following the death of my brother Tommy, I assumed that you wouldn't want to intrude on my grief, and then we just lost touch. If you will recall, after reading your cold-hearted and callous observations about the tragedy that befell my brother, I was extremely angry at you, and I told you that I would only communicate with Martins Dossou.

I wrote to Ms. Glokpon, and upon her reply, I will send her my banking particulars.

Ray Gunn

messages.body:
My dear Ms. Glokpon:

What a pleasure to finally hear from you, I have been awaiting some contact from you for several months, your employers, Magoro and Martins Dossou, both speak highly of you, and they say that you are a nice lady both in and out of the office, and "100% OK".

I wonder if I came to your offices to collect my share of these funds, perhaps we could get together for some out-of-the-office-"niceness". Your employers probably would not object to you showing me some extra gratitude for my participation in this transaction, would they? I have in mind some delightful romps in my hotel suite, I would be lodging at your finest hotel, of course, would you make the reservations, or should I?

My passport is in perfect order, and I can travel to your location within a very few days.

Will you please write and tell me if this proposition is acceptable?

In any event, my payment should be addressed to me:

RAYMOND ANZIO GUNN

4019 South Smith Street,

Gatling, Wyoming 49199

Waiting your immediate reply,

I remain, Ray Gunn, your admirer from USA

messages.body:
Dear Ms. Glokpon,

Hearty congratulations to you on your impending marriage! I am sure you will be a lovely bride, and I hope your husband-to-be realizes what a decent, moral lady you are, and appreciate this treasure you give him, your loyalty!

That being said, I will arrive in Benin next Monday, 12December. Please give me the exact address of your office, or dispatch someone to meet me at the airport when I deplane. He should be holding a large sign with my name on it, RAY GUNN. I will send you the exact time of my arrival, as soon as I get it from the airline.

Thank you, and again, I send my congratulations to you, and best wishes.

Ray Gunn

messages.body:
Dear Mr.Raymond,

Thanks a lot for your courage I really appreciate that, as regards to your arrangement to come down here and about the address you asked note that here in Benin Republic there is no road or street address, you can confirm that from Benin Embassy in your country,

After reading your mail this morning I decided to make some little inquiry about the possibility of you receiving the draft through our affiliate Bank in London our foreign remittance manager he told me that is possible, according the his explanation their will keep this draft and instruct their fiduciary agent in London to raise a draft worth that amount for you,so instead of you coming down here you will only travel to London and receive the draft.

Meanwhile I will be absent from work till Thursday because tomorrow morning I will travel to my village to finish arrangement about my traditional marriage which I told you. well if you insisted to come I will inform my cousin to meet you in any hotel lodge, but bear in mind that nobody will wait for you at the airport.

Reply and let me know your decision

Thanks

Rose Glokpon.
